Sequence Information.Peptide Name: SAAP fraction 2 (Surfactant-associated anionic peptides; Asp-rich, UCLL1; metallo-AMPs, natural AMPs; sheep, ruminant, mammals, animals; BBII)

Literature Information.Literature: This anionic antimicrobial peptide requires Zinc as a cofactor to kill bacteria. Active against (kill) P. haemolytica (MBC50 40 uM) in the presence of 10 uM ZnCl2. A recent study tested additional bacteria and found this peptide was inactive (MIC> 512 ug/ml). These include E.faecium BAA-2317, S.aureus ATCC 43300, K.pneumoniae 700603, A.baumannii 19606, P.aeruginosa 27853, E.coli ATCC 25922 and C.albicans 10231 (Miller et al., 2023) (Provided by Adriana Miller). Updated 7/2021; 2/2023.
Literature Information.Author: Brogden KA, de Lucca AJ, Bland J, Elliott S1996
Literature Information.Reference: Proc Natl Acad Sci U S A. 1996 Jan 9;93(1):412-6.PubMed
Literature Information.Title: Isolation of an ovine pulmonary surfactant-associated anionic peptide bactericidal for Pasteurella haemolytica
